tests.title: should not find a role not previously added
tests.fullTitle: acl hasRole(role) should not find a role not previously added
tests.code:
const
acl   = new Acl,
role  = 'role'
expect(acl.hasRole(role)).to.be.equal(false)

tests.title: should be able to find an existing role
tests.fullTitle: acl hasRole(role) should be able to find an existing role
tests.code:
const
acl   = new Acl,
role  = 'role'
expect(acl.hasRole(role)).to.be.equal(false)
acl.addRole(role)
expect(acl.hasRole(role)).to.be.equal(true)

tests.title: should be able to add a role
tests.fullTitle: acl addRole(role) should be able to add a role
tests.code:
const
acl   = new Acl,
role  = 'role'
expect(acl.hasRole(role)).to.be.equal(false)
acl.addRole(role)
expect(acl.hasRole(role)).to.be.equal(true)

tests.title: adding the same role multiple times wont reset it
tests.fullTitle: acl addRole(role) adding the same role multiple times wont reset it
tests.code:
const
acl   = new Acl,
role  = 'foo',
user  = 'bar'
acl.addRole(role)
acl.addRoleUser(role, user)
acl.addRole(role)
expect(acl.hasRoleUser(role, user)).to.be.equal(true)

tests.title: removing a non existing role wont throw
tests.fullTitle: acl removeRole(role) removing a non existing role wont throw
tests.code:
const
acl   = new Acl,
role  = 'foo'
expect(acl.removeRole.bind(acl, role)).to.not.throw()

tests.title: removing an existing role to be removed
tests.fullTitle: acl removeRole(role) removing an existing role to be removed
tests.code:
const
acl   = new Acl,
role  = 'foo'
acl.addRole(role)
expect(acl.hasRole(role)).to.be.equal(true)
acl.removeRole(role)
expect(acl.hasRole(role)).to.be.equal(false)

tests.title: should return false if child is not child of role
tests.fullTitle: acl hasRoleChild(role, child) should return false if child is not child of role
tests.code:
const
acl   = new Acl,
role  = 'foo',
child = 'bar'
expect(acl.hasRoleChild(role, child)).to.be.equal(false)
acl.addRole(role)
expect(acl.hasRoleChild(role, child)).to.be.equal(false)
acl.addRole(child)
expect(acl.hasRoleChild(role, child)).to.be.equal(false)

tests.title: should be able to find a child of a role
tests.fullTitle: acl hasRoleChild(role, child) should be able to find a child of a role
tests.code:
const
acl   = new Acl,
role  = 'foo',
child = 'bar'
acl.addRoleChild(role, child)
expect(acl.hasRoleChild(role, child)).to.be.equal(true)

tests.title: should return false if child does not derive from role
tests.fullTitle: acl hasRoleChildRecursively(role, child) should return false if child does not derive from role
tests.code:
const
acl           = new Acl,
role          = 'foo',
child         = 'bar',
childOfChild  = 'baz'
expect(acl.hasRoleChildRecursively(role, childOfChild)).to.be.equal(false)
acl.addRole(role)
expect(acl.hasRoleChildRecursively(role, childOfChild)).to.be.equal(false)
acl.addRole(child)
expect(acl.hasRoleChildRecursively(role, childOfChild)).to.be.equal(false)
acl.addRole(childOfChild)
expect(acl.hasRoleChildRecursively(role, childOfChild)).to.be.equal(false)
acl.addRoleChild(role, child)
expect(acl.hasRoleChildRecursively(role, childOfChild)).to.be.equal(false)

tests.title: should return true if child derives from role
tests.fullTitle: acl hasRoleChildRecursively(role, child) should return true if child derives from role
tests.code:
const
acl           = new Acl,
role          = 'foo',
child         = 'bar',
childOfChild  = 'baz'
acl.addRoleChild(role, child)
acl.addRoleChild(child, childOfChild)
expect(acl.hasRoleChildRecursively(role, childOfChild)).to.be.equal(true)

tests.title: should be able to add a child to a role
tests.fullTitle: acl addRoleChild(role, child) should be able to add a child to a role
tests.code:
const
acl   = new Acl,
role  = 'foo',
child = 'bar'
acl.addRoleChild(role, child)
expect(acl.hasRole(role)).to.be.equal(true)
expect(acl.hasRole(child)).to.be.equal(true)
expect(acl.hasRoleChild(role, child)).to.be.equal(true)

tests.title: should be able to remove a child from a role
tests.fullTitle: acl removeRoleChild(role, child) should be able to remove a child from a role
tests.code:
const
acl   = new Acl,
role  = 'foo',
child = 'bar'
acl.addRoleChild(role, child)
expect(acl.hasRoleChild(role, child)).to.be.equal(true)
acl.removeRoleChild(role, child)
expect(acl.hasRoleChild(role, child)).to.be.equal(false)

tests.title: should return true only if role has user
tests.fullTitle: acl hasRoleUser(role, user) should return true only if role has user
tests.code:
const
acl  = new Acl,
role = 'foo',
user = 'bar'
expect(acl.hasRoleUser(role, user)).to.be.equal(false)
acl.addRole(role)
expect(acl.hasRoleUser(role, user)).to.be.equal(false)
acl.addRoleUser(role, user)
expect(acl.hasRoleUser(role, user)).to.be.equal(true)

tests.title: adding a user to a role also creates the role
tests.fullTitle: acl addRoleUser(role user) adding a user to a role also creates the role
tests.code:
const
acl  = new Acl,
role = 'foo',
user = 'bar'
expect(acl.hasRole(role)).to.be.equal(false)
acl.addRoleUser(role, user)
expect(acl.hasRole(role)).to.be.equal(true)

tests.title: should be able to add a user to a role
tests.fullTitle: acl addRoleUser(role user) should be able to add a user to a role
tests.code:
const
acl  = new Acl,
role = 'foo',
user = 'bar'
expect(acl.hasRoleUser(role, user)).to.be.equal(false)
acl.addRoleUser(role, user)
expect(acl.hasRoleUser(role, user)).to.be.equal(true)

tests.title: should be able to remove a user from a role
tests.fullTitle: acl removeRoleUser(role, user) should be able to remove a user from a role
tests.code:
const
acl  = new Acl,
role = 'foo',
user = 'bar'
expect(acl.hasRoleUser(role, user)).to.be.equal(false)
acl.addRoleUser(role, user)
expect(acl.hasRoleUser(role, user)).to.be.equal(true)
acl.removeRoleUser(role, user)
expect(acl.hasRoleUser(role, user)).to.be.equal(false)

tests.title: should be able to remove a user from all roles
tests.fullTitle: acl removeUser(user) should be able to remove a user from all roles
tests.code:
const
acl   = new Acl,
role1 = 'foo',
role2 = 'bar',
role3 = 'baz',
user  = 'qux'
acl.addRoleUser(role1, user)
acl.addRoleUser(role2, user)
expect(acl.hasRoleUser(role1, user)).to.be.equal(true)
expect(acl.hasRoleUser(role2, user)).to.be.equal(true)
expect(acl.hasRoleUser(role3, user)).to.be.equal(false)
acl.removeUser(user)
expect(acl.hasRoleUser(role1, user)).to.be.equal(false)
expect(acl.hasRoleUser(role2, user)).to.be.equal(false)
expect(acl.hasRoleUser(role3, user)).to.be.equal(false)

tests.title: should return true only if the role has the resource
tests.fullTitle: acl hasRoleResource(role, resource) should return true only if the role has the resource
tests.code:
const
acl       = new Acl,
role      = 'foo',
resource  = 'bar'
expect(acl.hasRoleResource(role, resource)).to.be.equal(false)
acl.addRole(role)
expect(acl.hasRoleResource(role, resource)).to.be.equal(false)
acl.addRoleResource(role, resource)
expect(acl.hasRoleResource(role, resource)).to.be.equal(true)

tests.title: should be able to add a resource to a role
tests.fullTitle: acl addRoleResource(role, resource) should be able to add a resource to a role
tests.code:
const
acl       = new Acl,
role      = 'foo',
resource  = 'bar'
expect(acl.hasRoleResource(role, resource)).to.be.equal(false)
acl.addRoleResource(role, resource)
expect(acl.hasRoleResource(role, resource)).to.be.equal(true)

tests.title: should be able to remove a resource from a role
tests.fullTitle: acl removeRoleResource(role, resource) should be able to remove a resource from a role
tests.code:
const
acl       = new Acl,
role      = 'foo',
resource  = 'bar'
expect(acl.hasRoleResource(role, resource)).to.be.equal(false)
acl.addRoleResource(role, resource)
expect(acl.hasRoleResource(role, resource)).to.be.equal(true)
acl.removeRoleResource(role, resource)
expect(acl.hasRoleResource(role, resource)).to.be.equal(false)

tests.title: removing a resource from a role should not remove the role
tests.fullTitle: acl removeRoleResource(role, resource) removing a resource from a role should not remove the role
tests.code:
const
acl       = new Acl,
role      = 'foo',
resource  = 'bar'
acl.addRoleResource(role, resource)
acl.removeRoleResource(role, resource)
expect(acl.hasRole(role)).to.be.equal(true)

tests.title: should be able to remove a resource from all roles
tests.fullTitle: acl removeResource(resource) should be able to remove a resource from all roles
tests.code:
const
acl       = new Acl,
role1     = 'foo',
role2     = 'bar',
role3     = 'baz',
resource  = 'qux'
acl.addRole(role1)
acl.addRoleResource(role2, resource)
acl.addRoleResource(role3, resource)
expect(acl.hasRoleResource(role1, resource)).to.be.equal(false)
expect(acl.hasRoleResource(role2, resource)).to.be.equal(true)
expect(acl.hasRoleResource(role3, resource)).to.be.equal(true)
acl.removeResource(resource)
expect(acl.hasRoleResource(role1, resource)).to.be.equal(false)
expect(acl.hasRoleResource(role2, resource)).to.be.equal(false)
expect(acl.hasRoleResource(role3, resource)).to.be.equal(false)

tests.title: should return true only if the role has the permission
tests.fullTitle: acl hasRoleResourcePermission(role, resource, permission) should return true only if the role has the permission
tests.code:
const
acl   = new Acl,
role  = 'foo',
res   = 'bar',
per   = 'baz'
expect(acl.hasRoleResourcePermission(role, res, per)).to.be.equal(false)
acl.addRole(role)
expect(acl.hasRoleResourcePermission(role, res, per)).to.be.equal(false)
acl.addRoleResource(role, res)
expect(acl.hasRoleResourcePermission(role, res, per)).to.be.equal(false)
acl.addRoleResourcePermission(role, res, per)
expect(acl.hasRoleResourcePermission(role, res, per)).to.be.equal(true)

tests.title: should be able to add a permission to a role
tests.fullTitle: acl addRoleResourcePermission(role, resource, permission) should be able to add a permission to a role
tests.code:
const
acl   = new Acl,
role  = 'foo',
res   = 'bar',
per   = 'baz'
expect(acl.hasRoleResourcePermission(role, res, per)).to.be.equal(false)
acl.addRoleResourcePermission(role, res, per)
expect(acl.hasRoleResourcePermission(role, res, per)).to.be.equal(true)

tests.title: should add a resource to the role
tests.fullTitle: acl addRoleResourcePermission(role, resource, permission) should add a resource to the role
tests.code:
const
acl   = new Acl,
role  = 'foo',
res   = 'bar',
per   = 'baz'
expect(acl.hasRoleResource(role, res)).to.be.equal(false)
acl.addRoleResourcePermission(role, res, per)
expect(acl.hasRoleResource(role, res)).to.be.equal(true)

tests.title: should add a role
tests.fullTitle: acl addRoleResourcePermission(role, resource, permission) should add a role
tests.code:
const
acl   = new Acl,
role  = 'foo',
res   = 'bar',
per   = 'baz'
expect(acl.hasRole(role)).to.be.equal(false)
acl.addRoleResourcePermission(role, res, per)
expect(acl.hasRole(role)).to.be.equal(true)

tests.title: should remove a permission from a role resource
tests.fullTitle: acl removeRoleResourcePermission(role, resource, permission) should remove a permission from a role resource
tests.code:
const
acl   = new Acl,
role  = 'foo',
res   = 'bar',
per   = 'baz'
acl.addRoleResourcePermission(role, res, per)
expect(acl.hasRoleResourcePermission(role, res, per)).to.be.equal(true)
acl.removeRoleResourcePermission(role, res, per)
expect(acl.hasRoleResourcePermission(role, res, per)).to.be.equal(false)

tests.title: should remove a permission from a resource on all roles
tests.fullTitle: acl removeResourcePermission(resource, permission) should remove a permission from a resource on all roles
tests.code:
const
acl   = new Acl,
role1 = 'foo1',
role2 = 'foo2',
role3 = 'foo3',
res   = 'bar',
per   = 'baz'
acl.addRoleResource(role1, res)
acl.addRoleResourcePermission(role2, res, per)
acl.addRoleResourcePermission(role3, res, per)
expect(acl.hasRoleResourcePermission(role1, res, per)).to.be.equal(false)
expect(acl.hasRoleResourcePermission(role2, res, per)).to.be.equal(true)
expect(acl.hasRoleResourcePermission(role3, res, per)).to.be.equal(true)
acl.removeResourcePermission(res, per)
expect(acl.hasRoleResourcePermission(role1, res, per)).to.be.equal(false)
expect(acl.hasRoleResourcePermission(role2, res, per)).to.be.equal(false)
expect(acl.hasRoleResourcePermission(role3, res, per)).to.be.equal(false)

tests.title: should not remove the role and resouce
tests.fullTitle: acl removeResourcePermission(resource, permission) should not remove the role and resouce
tests.code:
const
acl   = new Acl,
role1 = 'foo1',
role2 = 'foo2',
role3 = 'foo3',
res   = 'bar',
per   = 'baz'
acl.addRoleResource(role1, res)
acl.addRoleResourcePermission(role2, res, per)
acl.addRoleResourcePermission(role3, res, per)
acl.removeResourcePermission(res, per)
expect(acl.hasRoleResource(role1, res, per)).to.be.equal(true)
expect(acl.hasRoleResource(role2, res, per)).to.be.equal(true)
expect(acl.hasRoleResource(role3, res, per)).to.be.equal(true)

tests.title: should return a list of all the roles a user have
tests.fullTitle: acl getUserRoles(user) should return a list of all the roles a user have
tests.code:
const
acl   = new Acl,
user  = 'foobar',
role1 = 'foo',
role2 = 'bar',
role3 = 'baz',
role4 = 'qux'
acl.addRoleUser(role1, user)
acl.addRoleUser(role2, user)
acl.addRoleChild(role1, role3)
acl.addRoleChild(role2, role4)
expect(acl.getUserRoles(user)).to.have.members([role1, role2])

tests.title: should return a list of roles and the derieved roles a user have
tests.fullTitle: acl getUserRolesRecursive(user, roles = []) should return a list of roles and the derieved roles a user have
tests.code:
const
acl       = new Acl,
user1     = 'foobar1',
user2     = 'foobar2',
role1     = 'foo',
role2     = 'bar',
role3     = 'baz',
role4     = 'qux',
expected  = [role1, role2, role3]
acl.addRoleUser(role1, user1)
acl.addRoleUser(role2, user1)
acl.addRoleChild(role1, role3)
acl.addRole(role4)
expect(acl.getUserRolesRecursively(user1)).to.have.members(expected)
acl.addRoleUser(role4, user2)
expect(acl.getUserRolesRecursively(user1)).to.have.members(expected)

tests.title: should only allow a valid permission
tests.fullTitle: acl hasUserPermission(user, resource, permission) should only allow a valid permission
tests.code:
const
acl         = new Acl,
user        = 'foo',
role        = 'bar',
resource    = 'baz',
permission  = 'qux'
acl.addRoleUser(role, user)
acl.addRoleResourcePermission(role, resource, permission)
const result = acl.hasUserPermission(user, resource, permission)
expect(result).to.be.equal(true)

tests.title: should allow a valid permission through a role hierarchy
tests.fullTitle: acl hasUserPermission(user, resource, permission) should allow a valid permission through a role hierarchy
tests.code:
const
acl         = new Acl,
user1       = 'foo1',
user2       = 'foo2',
role1       = 'bar1',
role2       = 'bar2',
resource1   = 'baz1',
resource2   = 'baz2',
permission  = 'qux'
acl.addRoleUser(role1, user1)
acl.addRoleUser(role2, user2)
acl.addRoleResourcePermission(role1, resource1, permission)
acl.addRoleResourcePermission(role2, resource2, permission)
const result1 = acl.hasUserPermission(user1, resource2, permission)
expect(result1).to.be.equal(false)
acl.addRoleChild(role1, role2)
const result2 = acl.hasUserPermission(user1, resource2, permission)
expect(result2).to.be.equal(true)

tests.title: should not allow an invalid permission
tests.fullTitle: acl hasUserPermission(user, resource, permission) should not allow an invalid permission
tests.code:
const
acl         = new Acl,
user1       = 'foo1',
user2       = 'foo2',
role1       = 'bar1',
role2       = 'bar2',
resource1   = 'baz1',
resource2   = 'baz2',
permission  = 'qux'
acl.addRoleUser(role1, user1)
acl.addRoleUser(role2, user2)
acl.addRoleResourcePermission(role1, resource1, permission)
acl.addRoleResourcePermission(role2, resource2, permission)
const result1 = acl.hasUserPermission(user1, resource1, permission)
expect(result1).to.be.equal(true)
const result2 = acl.hasUserPermission(user1, resource2, permission)
expect(result2).to.be.equal(false)

beforeHooks.title: "before all" hook
beforeHooks.code:
context(this, { title:'config', value:config })
Router = require('./router')
router = new Router(config)

tests.title: should return a flatten route
tests.fullTitle: controller/server/http/router flattenRoutes(routes) should return a flatten route
tests.code:
context(this, { title:'config', value:config })
const route = router.flattenRoutes(config)
expect(route.view).to.be.equal('json')
expect(route.policy).to.be.equal('/')
expect(route.dispatcher).to.be.equal('index')
expect(route.middleware.length).to.be.equal(2)

tests.title: middleware is an array
tests.fullTitle: controller/server/http/router findRoute(request) middleware is an array
tests.code:
const result = router.findRoute({ url:{ pathname:'/' }})
expect(result.middleware).is.an('array')

tests.title: middleware builds on
tests.fullTitle: controller/server/http/router findRoute(request) middleware builds on
tests.code:
const result = router.findRoute({ url:{ pathname:'/' }})
expect(result.middleware.length).to.be.equal(2)

tests.title: middleware routes correctly
tests.fullTitle: controller/server/http/router findRoute(request) middleware routes correctly
tests.code:
const result = router.findRoute({ url:{ pathname:'/foo' }})
expect(result.middleware.length).to.be.equal(1)

tests.title: middleware can be defined as an array
tests.fullTitle: controller/server/http/router findRoute(request) middleware can be defined as an array
tests.code:
const result = router.findRoute({ url:{ pathname:'/bar' }, method:'get'})
expect(result.middleware.length).to.be.equal(3)

tests.title: view is inherited
tests.fullTitle: controller/server/http/router findRoute(request) view is inherited
tests.code:
const result = router.findRoute({ url:{ pathname:'/' }})
expect(result.view).to.be.equal('json')

tests.title: found correct dispatcher
tests.fullTitle: controller/server/http/router findRoute(request) found correct dispatcher
tests.code:
const result = router.findRoute({ url:{ pathname:'/' }})
expect(result.dispatcher).to.be.equal('index')

tests.title: overwrite the view
tests.fullTitle: controller/server/http/router findRoute(request) overwrite the view
tests.code:

expect(result.view).to.be.equal('raw')

tests.title: first match should have hierarchy

tests.code:

expect(result.dispatcher).to.be.equal('bar')

expect(result.dispatcher).to.be.equal(undefined)

beforeHooks.title: "before all" hook
beforeHooks.code:
const Error = require('./index')
error = new Error()

tests.title: should be able to retrieve the error code set through `setCode`
tests.fullTitle: error/index setCode(code) should be able to retrieve the error code set through `setCode`
tests.code:
const code = 'ERR_VALUE_OUT_OF_RANGE'
error.setCode(code)

beforeHooks.title: "before all" hook
beforeHooks.code:
const
Request = require('@superhero/request'),
port    = 9001
context(this, { title:'config', value:config })
request = new Request({ url:'http://localhost:' + port })
core    = await require('../').bootstrap(config.bootstrap)
server  = core.http(config.routes)
server.listen(port)

tests.title: fetching a public resource
tests.fullTitle: controller/server/http fetching a public resource
tests.code:
const result = await request.get('/resource/master.css')
expect(result.status).to.be.equal(200)
expect(result.headers['content-type']).to.be.equal('text/css')
expect(result.data.includes('margin: 0')).to.be.equal(true)

tests.title: the rest dispatcher
tests.fullTitle: controller/server/http the rest dispatcher
tests.code:
const result =
{
  get     : await request.get('/rest'),
  post    : await request.post('/rest'),
  put     : await request.put('/rest'),
  delete  : await request.delete('/rest'),
  index   : await request.fetch('index', '/rest')
}
expect(result.get.status).to.be.equal(501)
expect(result.post.status).to.be.equal(501)
expect(result.put.status).to.be.equal(501)
expect(result.delete.status).to.be.equal(501)
expect(result.index.status).to.be.equal(400)

tests.title: a raw text response
tests.fullTitle: controller/server/http a raw text response

tests.title: a json response
tests.fullTitle: controller/server/http a json response

tests.title: a templated response
tests.fullTitle: controller/server/http a templated response
tests.code:
const result = await request.get('/test-templated')
expect(result.status).to.be.equal(200)
expect(result.data.startsWith('layout')).to.be.equal(true)
expect(result.data.includes('titled')).to.be.equal(true)
expect(result.data.includes('bazqux')).to.be.equal(true)

tests.title: the if helper
tests.fullTitle: controller/server/http the if helper
tests.code:
const result = await request.get('/test-templated')
// testing the "if" helper in the template
expect(result.data.includes('==')).to.be.equal(true)
expect(result.data.includes('!=')).to.be.equal(true)
expect(result.data.includes('<' )).to.be.equal(true)
expect(result.data.includes('<=')).to.be.equal(true)
expect(result.data.includes('>' )).to.be.equal(true)
expect(result.data.includes('>=')).to.be.equal(true)
expect(result.data.includes('&&')).to.be.equal(true)
expect(result.data.includes('||')).to.be.equal(true)
expect(result.data.includes('typeof')).to.be.equal(true)

tests.title: a none specified dispatcher should
tests.fullTitle: controller/server/http a none specified dispatcher should

tests.fullTitle: controller/server/http a failing dispatcher

tests.title: should return a stringified value of `vm.body`
tests.fullTitle: view/json compose(vm) should return a stringified value of `vm.body`
tests.code:
context(this, { title:'view model', value:vm })
expect(json.compose(vm)).to.be.equal(JSON.stringify(vm.body))

tests.title: should set the `vm.headers["content-type"]` to "application/json"
tests.fullTitle: view/json compose(vm) should set the `vm.headers["content-type"]` to "application/json"
tests.code:
context(this, { title:'view model', value:vm })
expect(vm.headers['content-type']).to.be.equal('application/json')

tests.title: expected a stringified version of the `vm.body`
tests.fullTitle: view/json compose(vm) expected a stringified version of the `vm.body`
tests.code:
context(this, { title:'view model', value:vm })
expect(json.compose(vm)).to.be.equal(JSON.stringify(vm.body))

tests.title: should return the value of `vm.body`
tests.fullTitle: view/raw compose(vm) should return the value of `vm.body`
tests.code:
context(this, { title:'view model', value:vm })
expect(raw.compose(vm)).to.be.equal(vm.body)

tests.title: should return the handlebars instance
tests.fullTitle: view/template static get handlebars should return the handlebars instance
tests.code: expect(Template.handlebars).to.be.equal(require('handlebars'))

tests.fullTitle: view/template/helper/calculate 1 + 1 = 2
tests.code: expect(calculate(1, '+', 1)).to.be.equal(2)

tests.fullTitle: view/template/helper/calculate 4 - 2 = 2
tests.code: expect(calculate(4, '-', 2)).to.be.equal(2)

tests.fullTitle: view/template/helper/calculate 3 * 3 = 9
tests.code: expect(calculate(3, '*', 3)).to.be.equal(9)

tests.fullTitle: view/template/helper/calculate 9 / 3 = 3
tests.code: expect(calculate(9, '/', 3)).to.be.equal(3)

tests.fullTitle: view/template/helper/calculate 5 % 3 = 2
tests.code: expect(calculate(5, '%', 3)).to.be.equal(2)

tests.title: empty operator should return an empty string
tests.fullTitle: view/template/helper/calculate empty operator should return an empty string
tests.code: expect(calculate(1, '', 1)).to.be.equal('')

tests.title: should return a concatted string
tests.fullTitle: view/template/helper/concat should return a concatted string
tests.code: expect(concat('foo','bar','baz')).to.be.equal('foobarbaz')

tests.title: should ignore objects or undefined arguments when concatting
tests.fullTitle: view/template/helper/concat should ignore objects or undefined arguments when concatting
tests.code: expect(concat('foo', undefined, {}, 'bar')).to.be.equal('foobar')

tests.title: should return a formated date string
tests.fullTitle: view/template/helper/dateformat should return a formated date string
tests.code: expect(dateformat(new Date(1524493378898), 'yyyy')).to.be.equal('2018')

tests.title: should return a string with escaped double quotes
tests.fullTitle: view/template/helper/escDoubleQuote should return a string with escaped double quotes
tests.code: expect(escDoubleQuote('foo "bar"')).to.be.equal('foo \\"bar\\"')

tests.title: should return a string with escaped singel quotes
tests.fullTitle: view/template/helper/escSingelQuote should return a string with escaped singel quotes
tests.code: expect(escSingelQuote("foo 'bar'")).to.be.equal("foo \\'bar\\'")

tests.title: should return a stringified json object
tests.fullTitle: view/template/helper/jsonStringify should return a stringified json object
tests.code: expect(jsonStringify({foo:'bar'})).to.be.equal('{"foo":"bar"}')

tests.title: should return a string stripped of html tags
tests.fullTitle: view/template/helper/stripTags should return a string stripped of html tags
tests.code:
expect(stripTags('

foobar

')).to.be.equal('foobar')

tests.title: should return a number if a number was given
tests.fullTitle: view/template/helper/stripTags should return a number if a number was given
tests.code: expect(stripTags(5)).to.be.equal(5)

tests.title: should return a padded number
tests.fullTitle: view/template/helper/toFixed should return a padded number
tests.code: expect(toFixed(5, 2)).to.be.equal('5.00')

tests.title: should be able to handle "null"
tests.fullTitle: view/template/helper/toFixed should be able to handle "null"
tests.code: expect(toFixed(null, 2)).to.be.equal('0.00')

tests.title: should return NaN if "undefined" is spcified
tests.fullTitle: view/template/helper/toFixed should return NaN if "undefined" is spcified
tests.code: expect(toFixed(undefined, 2)).to.be.equal('NaN')

tests.title: should be able to handle negative numbers
tests.fullTitle: view/template/helper/toFixed should be able to handle negative numbers
tests.code: expect(toFixed(-5, 2)).to.be.equal('-5.00')

tests.title: should be able to handle strings
tests.fullTitle: view/template/helper/toFixed should be able to handle strings
tests.code: expect(toFixed('5', 2)).to.be.equal('5.00')

tests.title: should be able to handle strings that is not formatted as a number
tests.fullTitle: view/template/helper/toFixed should be able to handle strings that is not formatted as a number
tests.code: expect(toFixed('foobar', 2)).to.be.equal('NaN')

tests.title: should return an uppercase string
tests.fullTitle: view/template/helper/toLowerCase should return an uppercase string
tests.code: expect(toLowerCase('FooBar')).to.be.equal('foobar')

tests.title: should return an uppercase string
tests.fullTitle: view/template/helper/toUpperCase should return an uppercase string
tests.code: expect(toUpperCase('Foobar')).to.be.equal('FOOBAR')
